comment: Worst class I've ever taken. Complete waste of time & money. Professor didn't do ANYTHING. One short announcement/week. Quizzes in D2L (autograded). Online resources are a joke... lecture videos with poor audio even worse PowerPoint slides. She canceled the group project the week before finals. Info in syllabus is outdated/wrong. I want a refund.

Class was nothing special. She's nice, but young so not very good at teaching. She basically just reads off the power points and does some example code here and there. Python assignments each week, quiz each module and exams are just the quiz questions. Final group project. Easy A but maybe if I was a CS major I'd have enjoyed the class more.
Don't take her for an online class. Don't do it.
DO NOT TAKE. Take any other professor

Awful Professor. Unfortunately had to take her and regret it so much. Class is easy and straightforward but she makes it harder than it has to be. Group project at the end that can make or break you so be careful.

Very poor lectures. She taught a class with a midterm average grade of 30 for the whole 1800-student group. Even though it's the lab grade, most of the contents are supposed to be taught from lecture, and she hardly helped.

She is okay at teaching but she does ask students to go to the front of the class to solve problems even if they are completely new but it is voluntary however, she does not continue the class unless someone does go up and code. Other than that as long as you do well on the quizzes it is the same question for the midterm and final! Easy grader too.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: teach from powerpoint so you kinda have to learn everything yourself, 10 quizzes are are ok the lab that is apart of it I what you need to worry about. final, midterm,group project, and quiz average are each 25% off grade.
easy class. but not help at all! learned everything self.  wasting time in class.

teaches straight from a powerpoint, was easier to skip class and just read the slides myself. in class she would make someone go to the front and practice and refuse to give hints even if we were completely lost, then act like it was our fault for not knowing despite either just learning it or the answer would be something she didnt teach us.
